synopsis: Vote to pass a bill that amends clean energy standards to require renewables generate 40 percent of electricity by 2035.
name: SB 33 - Amends State Clean Energy Standards to Require Renewables Generate 40 Percent of Electricity by 2035 - Delaware Key Vote
pg: Highlights: Establishes the following electricity standards delivered to Delaware customers by a commission-regulated utility (Sec. 1): For 2026 a cumulative percentage from eligible energy resources between 3.75 and 25.5 percent; For 2027 a cumulative percentage from eligible energy resources between 4 and 26 percent; For 2028 a cumulative percentage from eligible energy resources between 4.25 and 26.5 percent; For 2029 a cumulative percentage from eligible energy resources between 4.5 and 27 percent; For 2030 a cumulative percentage from eligible energy resources between 5 and 28 percent; For 2031 a cumulative percentage from eligible energy resources between 5.8 and 30 percent; For 2032 a cumulative percentage from eligible energy resources between 6.6 and 32 percent; For 2033 a cumulative percentage from eligible energy resources between 7.4 and 34 percent; For 2034 a cumulative percentage from eligible energy resources between 8.4 and 37 percent; and For 2035 a cumulative percentage from eligible energy resources between 10 and 40 percent.
